ExcelAlmaLookup.title: Possible to pass credentials if SRU requires authentication?

comments.body:
A new version of the tool was released today that supports connecting to the catalog with a username and password.  You can update to this version simply by downloading the installer again and running it.  Please let me know if you run into any issues with this new feature.  Thank you.

Tom Ventimiglia
Princeton University Library

ExcelAlmaLookup.title: Suggestion: Search and retrieve barcodes and PIDs

comments.body:
A new version of the tool was released today that can retrieve barcodes from the catalog.  However, using this feature still requires that your catalog administrator enable ISO 20775 Holdings, as noted earlier in this ticket.  It is not clear to me yet whether item PIDs can be retrieved, but if your institution does enable ISO 20775 Holdings, please let me know and I can investigate further.  Thank you.

Tom Ventimiglia
Princeton University Library

Work on staging with 62,484 files is only displaying 54,568 in the UploadSnapshot
Error uploading a 12MB file in production

comments.body:
Confirmed that with the new settings we can add the offending 12 MB file from both https://datacommons.princeton.edu/describe and from https://pdc-describe-staging.princeton.edu/describe - I was able to add the file via Firefox, Chrome, and Safari with no problems.

![pdc-describe](https://github.com/pulibrary/pdc_describe/assets/568286/46f779ef-9a52-4a41-a64b-7bdca3a02ed9)

![datacommons](https://github.com/pulibrary/pdc_describe/assets/568286/61fc1553-007c-4214-9d63-7e96c0a9d439)

I did not test if we change the Nginx conf file back to its original value (before PR https://github.com/pulibrary/princeton_ansible/pull/4510) it will fail in one of them but not the other, but I think we are OK with the changes that @kayiwa made.

princeton_ansible.title: Allow apache to handle very large cookie headers

comments.body: Setting `LimitRequestFieldSize 16380` (up from the default of 8190) in `/etc/apache2/sites-available/000-default.conf` on the staging server fixed the problem. It would still be nice to know where this enormous cookie originates.
Closed by #4533

pulfalight.title: Non Princeton Aeon Users lose their Shopping Cart

comments.body:
The request from Atlas is to only submit the values set in this method and the data merged in from the grouping_options method a single time per post: https://github.com/pulibrary/pulfalight/blob/d1cb83c06764e76c46def7cebd83a2bf40316430/app/values/aeon_request.rb#L42-L51. Which of these three options would be the best way to go? 

1. Figure out a way to do this on the server side. (I'm struggling to do this ATM)
2. Add a handler in the Vue layer that checks to see if they already exist in the DOM when you click "Request this Box"
3. Add a handler in the Vue layer that strips out duplicate values when you submit the cart. 

I've advised Atlas that Location value can vary amongst individual request items on a given POST containing more than a single object. They are getting back to me on that question, they may have to enhance Aeon to deal with this from sites that use Remote POSTs and Single Sign On. As a test for now we can just submit that value as a constant.
Oh interesting. How weird, why would any of this cause the problem but only for non CAS folks? Also doesn't it still break for just one container?

Multiple containers do work right now for CAS users. Atlas says doing this
will fix the logon woes for non-CAS folks, allow you to execute requests
for multiple containers, and will also address the other issue
https://github.com/pulibrary/pulfalight/issues/1335 related to bundling
requests for items that share the same container into a single Aeon
request.

On Tue, Dec 12, 2023 at 10:32 AM Trey Pendragon ***@***.***>
wrote:

> Oh interesting. How weird, why would any of this cause the problem but
> only for non CAS folks? Also doesn't it still break for just one container?
>
> —
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/pulibrary/pulfalight/issues/1334#issuecomment-1852392531>,
> or unsubscribe
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AACECKJXNU56AYMED55M5H3YJCBLTAVCNFSM6AAAAAA6WUXGESVHI2DSMVQWIX3LMV43OSLTON2WKQ3PNVWWK3TUHMYTQNJSGM4TENJTGE>
> .
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.Message ID:
> ***@***.***>
>

Did some testing with some input from Atlas Support. It seems the POST works best when both the AeonForm and WebRequestForm are set to the value "EADRequest", see https://github.com/pulibrary/pulfalight/pull/1325. 

If you can construct the DOM to not duplicate the parameters mentioned in the earlier comment multiple requests can work both SSO and non Aeon Users. Proof of concept in HTML in the next comment.

``` Sample Multiple form Request

A Test Form for Pulfa

```

The top-level "Location" parameter is overridden by the "Location_{box-id}}" params from the individual requests. Basically all of the params they should not be duplicated could be treated as constant data that would be same for every single request we submit.

Here is another test html page for two distinct folders that share a container that should be bundled into a single Aeon requests. ```

External EAD Submission Test - Grouped

```

tiger-data-app.title: Project Details page - names in role values
Project Details page - displaying multiple departments

comments.body:
@JaymeeH we will eventually have more fields available to enter/edit in forms, including some of those that are currently automatic settings. We will also eventually have a way to update provenance values via interoperation with other systems. But in this preliminary phase, the editable fields are limited, as shown in #113 and #248. All we need is for this issue is for the "Project Details" page to have a place to display "Automatic Settings" and "Provenance" values (which will be set for a given project by other means).

Right now, we just show roles and (project) description:
![image](https://github.com/pulibrary/tiger-data-app/assets/66128387/9498c9e0-e743-4c82-ad67-e0b7783265b6)

But what we need is a more complete overview of the project details, like this:
![image](https://github.com/pulibrary/tiger-data-app/assets/66128387/a40061f1-3f11-4bd5-8ef9-12ea8ac3141b)

And again, this issue is just about getting the headings cleaned up: "Roles", "Description", "Automatic Settings", and "Provenance"
